title: Data Analyst - Stroke/Neuro Program
description: Shift: Full time, Days<p><br></p>Reporting to the Director of Performance Improvement, uses various systems and data gathering tools to prepare and disseminate reports, charts, to analyze trends related to the continuum of care. Works closely with the Director of Performance Improvement to develop and maintain hospital-wide dashboards. Supports the data gathering and analysis activities as required by performance improvement projects. Coordinates data with all units and departments as required for purposes of improving the continuum of care.<p><br></p><ul><li> Works with the Director of Performance Improvement utilizing a variety of databases and data gathering tools to provide information to help drive or evaluate patient care. Generates reports designed to assist in improving safety and quality and reducing costs and improving the efficiency of providing care. Utilizes system resources to blend various data sources and prepares reports including charts and graphs using data to demonstrate trends; presents data at appropriate meetings to identify areas of opportunity for improvement.</li><li> Extracts data from multiple internal sources, and interacts with a variety of hospital departments based on requests for information and as instructed. Meets with management and/or requesting party to determine data requirements. Compiles data, reviews for accuracy, and formulates presentations and analysis of data for various teams as needed.</li><li> Prepares and ensures accurate routine statistical data; extracts data and verifies accuracy of data; utilizes data to prepare summary tables, charts and graphs to be used for planning and assessing organizational effectiveness.</li><li> Uses a variety of data sources to prepare dashboards or ad hoc reports. Completes departmental monthly statistical reports. Assists in and performs various special projects and leads in data gathering and abstraction for current trend analysis. Compares trending and values to baseline and/or previous time period data; notifies management of variances; researches and rectifies variances.</li></ul><p><br></p> <p><br></p><ul><li> Participates in specified committee meetings and initiatives. Provides agenda, handouts, contacts members, prepares and distributes minutes as required.</li><li> Performs other department support duties as assigned.</li><li> Adheres to all Northwest Community Healthcare standards, policies and procedures.</li><li> Bachelors degree or equivalent in a clinical discipline, statistics/biostatistics, data science, or science</li><li> Experience working in health care or a health care-related field in a position requiring database management preferred</li><li> Interpersonal skills needed to interact effectively with clinicians including physicians, nurses, and others in an academic medical center</li><li> Collect data and maintain database(s) for stroke research projects</li><li> Maintain and improve a database evaluating stroke clinical performance in order to guide process improvement</li><li> Maintain and improve a quality metrics database to identify and facilitate clinical review of stroke patients</li><li> Analyze databases and summary reports, identify trends in clinical performance, and perform statistical analyses and data visualizations to help understand the magnitude and potential factors influencing these trends.</li><li> Perform "drill down" investigations when clinical or process measures are not met to identify potential factors influencing these trends.</li><li> Facilitate case updates for allied clinicians including Emergency Medical Services, referring physicians, and clinical care teams</li><li> Maintain and collect stroke time metrics and provide the appropriate teams feedback of TNK and IR cases</li><li> Assist in maintaining comprehensive stroke certification, including preparing presentations on data use and clinical performance metrics</li><li> Track annual education requirements for clinicians to help facilitate DNV maintenance of stroke certification</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Primary Location</strong><p><br></p>United States-Illinois-Arlington Job<p><br></p><strong>Employee Status</strong><p><br></p>Regular

title: Data Analyst - Research Specialist - Center for Research Acceleration - Full-Time
description: Research<p><br></p>Chicago, IL<p><br></p>ID: 54529<p><br></p>Full-Time/Regular<p><br></p>The Data Analyst - Research Specialist will be part of the Research Team. The analyst will support the needs of Shirley Ryan AbilityLab researchers by utilizing the Enterprise Data Warehouse, REDCap. The Data Analyst - Research Specialist will work within the Research Team help facilitate data requests, and data collection for our researchers.<p><br></p>The Data Analyst - Research Specialist will consistently demonstrate support of the Shirley Ryan AbilityLab statement of Vision, Mission and Core Values by striving for excellence, contributing to the team efforts and showing respect and compassion for patients and their families, fellow employees, and all others with whom there is contact at or in the interest of the institute.<p><br></p>The Data Analyst - Research Specialist will demonstrate Shirley Ryan AbilityLab Core Attributes: Communication, Accountability, Flexibility/Adaptability, Judgment/Problem Solving, Customer Service and Core Values (Hope, Compassion, Discovery, Collaboration, &amp; Commitment to Excellence) while fulfilling job duties.<p><br></p>Principal Responsibilities<p><br></p><strong><u>The Data Analyst – Research Specialist</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Gathers, profiles, and analyzes data to support research requirements for data collection.</li><li>Collaborates with research experts and staff from multiple business units to understand and implement research requirements.</li><li>Generates reports that ensure data integrity by applying data extraction and processing methods.</li><li>Performs data manipulation on large sets of data to facilitate identification of potential research participants and to produce data sets for statistical analysis.</li><li>Combines data from different sources and conducts source to target mapping.</li><li>Identifies trends and patterns in data and creates data visualizations.</li><li>Performs complex analysis including statistical regression and forecasting.</li><li>Performs other duties that may be assigned in the best interest of the Shirley Ryan AbilityLab.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, Engineering or related field. Masters preferred.</li><li>Minimum of 2 years of related experience with a comprehensive knowledge of data modeling, and database concepts (e.g. relational databases, Enterprise Data Warehouses, data modeling for research etc.) and continues developing professional expertise.</li><li>Minimum of 2 years of SQL scripting experience required. PostgreSQL experience preferred.</li><li>Data cleaning, engineering, and munging experience with scripting and programming languages such as Python, PERL, Ruby, PHP, Java, R/Shiny, etc., as well as building interfaces using APIs. Strong preference for Python experience.</li><li>Hands-on Experience with the Research Electronic Data Capture (REDCap) application.</li><li>Healthcare experience highly desired, especially familiarity with ICD-9, ICD-10, CPT, and other healthcare vocabularies, as well as HIPAA regulations as they relate to research.</li><li>Hands-on Experience with compiling data sets for research purposes and statistical analysis.</li><li>Hands-on Experience with clinical and behavioral research methods.</li><li>Hands-on Experience with electronic medical/health record systems (EMRs/EHRs), with preference for Cerner.</li><li>Hands-on experience with statistical software packages and data mining tools (e.g. R, Python, SPSS, Weka, etc.).</li><li>Hands-on experience with industry leading data visualization and BI tools (e.g. Business Objects, Microsoft PowerBI, Cognos, Tableau, OBIEE, Qlikview, Knowi, etc.).</li><li>Strong strategic, analytical, technical, and project management skills.</li><li>Demonstrated ability in engaging and communicating with stakeholders, across both business and technology functions.</li></ul><p><br></p>Reporting Relationships<p><br></p><ul><li>Reports to the Executive Director, Center for Research Acceleration and the Vice President Technology</li></ul><p><br></p>Working Conditions<p><br></p><ul><li>Normal office environment with little or no exposure to dust or extreme temperature.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Shirley Ryan AbilityLab</u></strong><p><br></p>Shirley Ryan AbilityLab is the global leader in physical medicine and rehabilitation for adults and children with the most severe, complex conditions. By joining our team, you will be part of our life-changing Mission and Vision. You’ll work in a truly inclusive environment where diversity and equity are championed through words and actions. You’ll contribute to an innovative culture that is second to none, one that embraces curiosity, discovery and compassion. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.<p><br></p>Shirley Ryan AbilityLab is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>Company: </strong>Oak Street Health<br><br><strong>Title:</strong> Engineer II, Analytics<br><br><strong>Location: </strong>Treehouse / Remote<br><br><strong><u>Role Description<br><br></u></strong>As an Analytics Engineer, you will help design new data models and implement complex data pipelines that are core to making sure we target the right services to the right patients. Our team is rebuilding our data warehouse using Palantir's Foundry data platform, and we are looking for a curious, motivated, and thoughtful Analytics Engineer to join the team.<br><br><strong><u>Core Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Partner with Product to design data models for the various types of healthcare data we receive (claims, EHR, etc.)</li><li>Develop ELT data pipelines in Foundry to create data products that serve operational stakeholders in the business</li><li>Perform QA on developed pipelines and setup monitoring for data quality issues</li><li>Support technical documentation of new data platform</li><li>Evaluate legacy data warehouse to assure that pain points are being appropriately addressed with new data models and pipelines<br></li></ul><strong>What are we looking for?<br></strong><ul><li>BS in an analytic area (Engineering, Economics, Mathematics, Business, etc.)</li><li>Minimum of 3 years of analytic engineering experience</li><li>Data driven mindset with strong attention to detail</li><li>Self-starter who can dive into a new domain and learn quickly</li><li>Comfort working with SQL and Python</li><li>Naturally curious, independent, and eager to learn new things</li><li>US work authorization</li><li>Passionate about working in the healthcare space for a mission driven organization</li><li>Someone who embodies being “Oaky”<br></li></ul><strong>What does being “Oaky” look like?<br></strong><ul><li>Radiating positive energy</li><li>Assuming good intentions</li><li>Creating an unmatched patient experience</li><li>Driving clinical excellence</li><li>Taking ownership and delivering results</li><li>Being scrappy<br></li></ul><strong><u>Why Oak Street Health?<br><br></u></strong>Oak Street Health is on a mission to “Rebuild healthcare as it should be'', providing personalized primary care for older adults on Medicare, with the goal of keeping patients healthy and living life to the fullest. Our innovative care model is centered right in our patient’s communities, and focused on the quality of care over volume of services. We’re an organization on the move! title: Database Engineer
description: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>A self-motivated individual responsible for database object design, development, maintenance for the enterprise application data model and database administration both on-premise and in the Azure Cloud. Ensures enterprise database procedures, methodologies and standards are maintained across the application teams. Performs database promotions to all servers per Service Level Agreements. Provides necessary production problem resolution to support departmental server up time goals. Assists with SQL Server upgrades to the Enterprise.<br><br>This is a Hybrid position- requires time in our Oakbrook Terrace, IL central office. Typically,1- 2 days per week and as needed..<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Provides login and security maintenance. </li><li> Monitors database performance. </li><li> Supports and provides tables, constraints, and triggers in a timely manner to several application development teams in a multi-tasking environment. </li><li> Reviews stored procedures and ensures that The Joint Commission database standards, guidelines, proper naming conventions and T-SQL coding techniques for optimal performance are enforced. </li><li> Creates logical and physical data model diagrams using 3 rd party tools. </li><li> Rotates on-call 24/7 production support. </li><li> Provides nonproduction and production promotions in a timely fashion according to SLA. </li><li> Monitors database integrity in a proactive manner. </li><li> Performs SQL Server installs and upgrades. </li><li> Supports the Disaster Recovery tests under supervision. </li><li> Performs other duties as requested by the team and business. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Three to five years’ experience in relational database systems. </li><li> Experience with implementing SSIS / SSRS. </li><li> BS, BA degree in computer science or equivalent experience. </li><li> Lean / Six Sigma Yellow Belt </li><li> Microsoft Certified Azure Data Fundamentals is a plus. </li><li> Knowledge of a scripting language, preferably PowerShell or JSON or Python. </li><li> Demonstrated knowledge of relational database concepts and modeling, with a high technical aptitude in database management. </li><li> Experience in the use of SQL and T-SQL for query and transaction processing. </li><li> Working knowledge of a programming environment (i.e. .Net Framework, Entity Framework). </li><li> Excellent oral and written communication skills. </li><li> Excellent troubleshooting and performance tuning skills. </li><li> Ability to use Profiler and DMV. </li><li> Experience with data modeling tools. </li><li> 1-2 years’ experience with SQL Azure or any other cloud database platform. <br></li></ul><strong> Note: Successful applicants for domestic positions that require travel to a customer site must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. <br><br></strong>This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by an employee assigned to this position. The description is not an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, knowledge, skills, and abilities, and working conditions associated with this position. All requirements are subject to possible modification and reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

Constellation offers customers a range of clean, zero-carbon energy solutions to help reduce their carbon footprint and achieve their sustainability goals.<p><br></p>We are committed to advancing diversity, equity and inclusion and believe in attracting, retaining and advancing employees who will best serve and represent our customers, partners and communities. available environment. </li><li>Working knowledge of Active Directory management and configuration. </li><li>Configure and maintain server processes, configurations, and backups</li><li>Maintain and We’re a group of good-natured, nimble go-getters dedicated to helping people and businesses build better with technology. That means when we see opportunities to create, we go for it. We don’t let the unknown stop us from solving challenges and winning together. And most importantly, we treat each other like adults. If you can see possibilities where others see problems, have candid conversations to ensure all voices are heard and thrive in a collaborative environment, you’ll do some of the best work of your career here.<br><br>On the Pando Design System team, we explore and solve problems at the intersection of design and engineering. We are currently building a React focused design system in hopes of making it fully agnostic with forward-thinking, unlike any other we have seen! Pando is focused on flexibility, accessibility and performance and its layered libraries enable utilization with any Javascript framework.<br><br>In this role, you will help support 40+teams across all of Pluralsight’s products, improving code quality, scalability, efficiency and the experience for our customers.<br><br><strong><u>What You’ll Contribute To<br></u></strong><ul><li>The libraries that make up the Pando Design System</li><li>User support through documentation and hands-on assistance</li><li>Understand, practice, and advocate for Engineering@Pluralsight principles and practices </li><li>Inspire and support fellow engineers. Champion the Engineering community at Pluralsight through leadership; upskill everyone around you.<br></li></ul><strong><u>What We’re Looking For<br></u></strong><ul><li>Frontend focus - you have 7+ recent years of frontend experience or 5+ recent years working on design systems</li><li>Framework familiarity - you have demonstrable experience with React, Javascript, Next.js, and Node. SolidJS is a plus.</li><li>Systems thinker - you consider broad architectural implications in solutions; have shipped and supported general library code for a broad user base. You have a foundational understanding and experience with topics related to platform scale, security, availability, deployment and operations</li><li>Design sensibility - you speak the language of designers; are an advocate for the user</li><li>Great teammate: You are a team member first and individual contributor second. A strong collaborator; a trusted teammate; skilled at resolving and working through different ideas. Your success is the team’s success</li><li>Self-sufficient - you can work independently, successfully handle your own workload, proactively drive improvements in software design and development practices and take personal accountability and ownership for timelines, delivery, behaviors and self-improvement. </li><li>Innovator: a creative problem-solver who is able to analyze sophisticated problems, break them down into smaller parts, and find effective solutions for customers. You bring innovative ideas to the team, which help us tackle ambitious problems in novel ways.</li><li>Urgent Curiosity: You love to learn, discover new information or solutions quickly, and are highly-motivated to explore, understand new concepts, and apply this understanding as quickly as possible for customers.</li><li>A phenomenal communicator: You are self-aware, insightful, and proactive, and an excellent written and verbal communicator. We are a completely remote team and communication is key to our success. You are not afraid to be yourself, experiment, make mistakes and learn from them, ask questions, or voice your concerns.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Ways We Work<br></u></strong><ul><li>Software Craftsmanship - we want to be proud of our work.</li><li>Test-Driven Development - we own our product from design thru deployment without QA engineers</li><li>Pair programming - we value collaborative development</li><li>Continuous Delivery - we independently ship code on a regular basis!</li><li>Trusting leaders - who empower us to build the right solutions for our customer<br></li></ul>We know there are candidates who might not fit everything we’ve described above, or who might have experience and skills we haven’t considered. If that’s you, don’t hesitate to apply.<br><br><em>Bring yourself. Pluralsight is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age or veteran status.<br><br></em>
